title: Widevine Content Decryption Module 4.10.2209.1
content:
To all Firefox gurus:

RE: Widevine Content Decryption Module 4.10.2209.1

Have Firefox 78.10.0esr (64-bit) with PLug-in Widevine Content Decryption Module 4.10.2209.1

Have (Late-2012) Mac Mini with Mac OSX 10.9.5 (A MUST HAVE, due to it being the last version that is compatible with Nikon and other software no longer supported)

So, upgrading Mac Operating System is not an option.

And, upgrading Firefox does not seem to be an option, because 78.10.0esr is the last compatible version with the Mac 10.9.5 operating system.

The issue I am having is when I go to read the online edition of the newspaper. a long thin yellow bar appears at the top of the screen with "The Widevine Cdm has crashed. (Learn More)" and further down on the page it shows, "Video Player Error Sorry, there has been a technical error with this video stream." with an error code that relates to "Digital Rights Management" . . . It is checked in Preferences > General.

So, not sure what the problem is.

This has occurred within the past two weeks ONLY.

Any help or advice would be appreciated.

Thank you, in advance.
creator: shepherds_pie

title: Captura de pantalla
content:
Saludos a la comunidad.

Quisiera saber si a alguien le pasó esto y ha podido resolverlo: desapareció la opción de 'Capturar pantalla'. Ya busqué información, revisé y edité el archivo about:config -aunque estaba en su ajuste correcto- y sigue sin aparecer. Es una función muy práctica que uso con frecuencia. Cualquier ayuda es bien agradecida.

(Adjunto imagen)
creator: kuguarg2

title: movies
content: i can not watch movies on either youtube, netflix and disney +
creator: mth230701

title: Is there a way to backup 'Cookies and Site Data' so if a refresh is needed, all permissions aren't lost
content: Under about:preferences#privacy there is a section 'Cookies and Site Data'. I have my settings set to CUSTOM and block all cookies. I then have managed my exceptions. I did a refresh resently, all that was lost. The best I can do currently is to have wordpad open and manually type each line out in my exceptions and then if needed in the future, I could copy and paste. There might be a better way that I do not know. I do know by default, the 'Managed Exceptions' under 'Cookies and Site Data' does not save if 'Refreshed'. Please address a better process and not my choice on blocking all cookies, thank you.
creator: PH8978

title: VPN issue
content: Since I installed Firefox VPN when I search in Firefox or Google, response generally is in a foreign language. How do I turn Firefox VPN off?
creator: johnbackman
